newsitem.title: SWEDEN: RIKSBANK POLL SHOWS HIGHER INFLATION EXPECTATIONS.
newsitem.headline: RIKSBANK POLL SHOWS HIGHER INFLATION EXPECTATIONS.

text.p: Swedish inflation expectations have risen slightly since February, a survey of the country's business sector commissioned by the Swedish central bank, the Riksbank, showed on Wednesday.

The survey of money market players, purchasing managers and members of employees' and employers' organisations, showed they expect Swedish consumer prices to rise 1.5 percent in one year, 1.8 percent in two years and 2.1 percent in five years.
